timeline.message: add server test case for score calculation

timeline.bodyText: This JavaDoc should be stored in the corresponding interface.
timeline.author: krusche

replies.bodyText: This is now removed, since it is already documented in the superclass.
replies.author: schultek

timeline.bodyText: this is unreadable and not understandable. Please do not abuse the stream API and simplify this code so that it is easier to understand!
timeline.author: krusche

replies.bodyText: I improved the code readability here.
replies.author: schultek

timeline.bodyText: please add some inline comments what you are doing here! Otherwise the code is hard to understand!
timeline.author: krusche

replies.bodyText:
I would also suggest to extract two additional methods here.
One takes case about the tests, the other one about static code analysis.
The method updateScore takes care about invoking both (the 2nd only if static code analysis is enabled)
replies.author: krusche

replies.bodyText: I improved the readability and separated the penalty calculation into a new function.
replies.author: schultek

timeline.author: krusche

replies.bodyText: It's unclear why you need an ObjectMapper here
replies.author: krusche

replies.bodyText: Added comments and improved the code readability.

timeline.message: Merge branch 'feature/programming-exercise/sca-grading' of https://github.com/ls1intum/Artemis into feature/programming-exercise/sca-grading

timeline.author: kloessst

timeline.bodyText: All feedback which is currently invisible will be removed and not saved in the database if I understand this right. This has the advantage that feedback doesn't need to be filtered when sending it to the client but also makes a proper re-evaluate impossible.
timeline.author: kloessst

timeline.bodyText: I think this information should be added when the feedback is generated.
timeline.author: kloessst
kloessst

timeline.bodyText: I don't think this condition does what is supposed to do. If programmingExercise.getMaxStaticCodeAnalysisPenalty() is null, the user does not want to apply a limit. Here 0>0 is false and the grading won't take place.
timeline.author: kloessst

timeline.bodyText: I think the testCasePoints need to be capped first and then the penalty is subtracted. Imagine bonusPoints+maxPoints = 20. Temporarily, a student can get more test case points e.g. 30 in this calculation and then the subtracted penalty would not have any effect.
timeline.author: kloessst

replies.bodyText: please fix it in this PR
replies.author: krusche

timeline.bodyText: I think a division by zero is possible here.
timeline.author: kloessst

timeline.bodyText: I think programmingExercise.getMaxStaticCodeAnalysisPenalty() could be null and this needs to be checked.
timeline.author: kloessst

timeline.bodyText: It might be possible to store the mappings in a more efficient way. For example a Map with keys Pair<Tool,Rule> and values the category names. This must only be created once at startup. This can also be done in a follow-up.
timeline.author: kloessst
